briefTitle: Investigation of 1.2% Sodium Hyaluronate for Treatment of Painful Chronic Osteoarthritis of the Knee
officialTitle: A 26 Week, Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo-Controlled Study of the Efficacy and Safety of Single Intra-Articular Injection 1.2% Sodium Hyaluronate for Treatment of Painful Osteoarthritis of the Knee, With Optional 26-Week Open-Label Safety Extension
summary: Subjects with chronic osteoarthritis of the knee will be assigned to receive an injection of either 1.2% sodium hyaluronate or buffered saline to evaluate its effectiveness and safety for 26 weeks. After 26 weeks, subjects can elect to receive a second injection of 1.2% sodium hyaluronate and be followed for another 26 weeks.

primaryOutcome.measure: Change From Baseline in the Visual Analogue Score (VAS) Pain Score of the 50-foot Walk Test at Week 26
